title: Ticket #5606: undocumented change to MAX_DEFAULT_LOG
description:
The change below is not reflected in the 8.5.3 manual which also seems to have an indentation problem in that area. 

  root@greatdane:/etc/condor# service condor start
  Starting up Condor...    dprintf() had a fatal error in pid 4400
  Invalid config. MAX_DEFAULT_LOG must be a size, not a time in this version of HTCondor.
   errno: 22 (Invalid argument) euid: 0, ruid: 0
   failed to start Condor with "/usr/sbin/condor_master -pidfile /run/condor/condor.pid".
remarks:
2016-Apr-07 11:12:53 by gthain:
Tom:

What's the value of MAX_DEFAULT_LOG in this case, and what's the behaviour you'd like to see? Currently, HTCondor doesn't support time-based rotation of log files that have multiple writers (mainly the shadows).

2016-Apr-18 11:54:48 by tpdownes:
That's not what the 8.5.3 manual says on page 204.
creator: tpdownes
